Today, we will talk about the pronunciation of some of the words used in the article. The pronunciation of some of the words used in the article can be a bit tricky. Would you like me to help you practice pronunciation of these words?
User Yes, please. What are some of the difficult words to pronounce in the article?
Mini Some of the pronunciation points to consider might include words that end in "z," such as "затрібно" and "гришеньо" as well as those with multiple syllables, such as "дпетревций" and "неделяюєнфотостмежністи". Additionally, some of the words might include sounds that don't exist in English like "ї" and "і" in the words "Орицитга" and "Ліиуџ".
User Thank you for the examples, I will definitely keep it in mind. How do I differentiate between "з" and "З" -- are they the same in Ukrainian?
Mini Yes, there are two distinct letters in Ukrainian, "з" and "З". The former is pronounced with a hard "z" sound, similar to the English "z," while the latter is softer and has a bit of a "s" sound at the end "з".
User That's good to know. Thank you for your help!
Mini You're welcome. Do you have any further questions or concerns that you would like to discuss?

data.sampled:
Today, in Kiev, the Cabinet adopted a new law to ban smoking in public places and on public transportation. Additionally, the Cabinet allocated 200 hryvnias to be spent on re-equipping public transportation with new buses, new train cars, and improved facilities. The Cabinet also allocated additional funding for the construction of playgrounds, which are the focus of various new initiatives to assist children with disabilities.

The Cabinet has extended sanctions, and restrictions on the use of roads from three to eight hours in certain cities. Also, a new law regarding the payment of compensation to military men who have been serving for more than 1.5 years at the front has been adopted, extending the total payment to Hryvnia 90, which is 4.5 billion. This brings the total value of compensation to more than KZ15 billion.

A new program will also be implemented on behalf of orphaned children. These are children whose parents were killed during the "Orange Revolution," or whose parents went out of order with former President Kuchma. The program will provide these children with all their needs, starting from school age.

On the financial side, the Cabinet reported on the "successful completion of the implementation of the tax reform," which was completed by more than 120 thousand taxpayers. Also, a document was submitted concerning the implementation of the law of state registration and taxation of small and medium-sized businesses. The Cabinet also allocated an Hryvnia 500 million for the purchase of new medical equipment. Additionally, another law was adopted on the extension of medical health benefits for all Ukrainian residents by about 40%.

Following on from the recent agreement in the Cabinet with the Ministry of Internal Affairs on "improvement of city infrastructure," the Cabinet allocated Hryvianis for the reconstruction of Kyiv's public transportation and other facilities, and also Hryvianis for the reconstruction of the main city highway
